results.title: Minimum Requirements for Car Insurance in California? - NK Law Group

results.title: Vehicle Code § 16056 VC - Minimum Auto Insurance
results.description: California Vehicle Code § 16056 VC requires automobiles registered in the state to carry liability insurance with a minimum coverage of $30,000/$60,000/$15,000.

results.title: What You Need to Know About the 2025 State Minimum Insurance Limit Increase
results.description: Here’s an overview of these changes, why they matter, and how to ensure your auto-owners insurance coverage aligns with the new standards: Every state mandates a minimum level of liability insurance that drivers must carry to operate a vehicle legally. This coverage is designed to handle costs related to accidents, such as medical expenses and property repairs, when the policyholder is at fault. California’s minimum requirements, which have remained static for decades, are among the lowest nationwide, but this will change starting in 2025.
